page.title: 09HOTHFIELD COMMON
page.content:
Hothfield Common is a local{Nature {Reserve}run by the{Nature Conservancy {Council.
The common is for used for picnicking and leisure activities by local people.
The{wildlife}is mainly small birds, rabbits and insects. Part of the area is woodland, the rest being open heathland.
The ground slopes down westward to the Great Stour river, the open ground providing lovely views.
The traffic noise from the A20 is hardly noticeable due to the back-crop of trees along the eastern edge of the common.
